lion.description: The lion is a large wild cat known for its strength and pride-based social structure.
lion.safety_tips: Do not approach lions in the wild. Keep a safe distance and never provoke them.

tiger.description: Tigers are solitary, powerful cats found mainly in Asia, with distinctive stripes.
tiger.safety_tips: Avoid forests where tigers roam. Make noise when hiking and never get too close.

elephant.description: Elephants are the largest land mammals, known for their intelligence and strong social bonds.
elephant.safety_tips: Keep distance from elephants in the wild. Never block their path or come between mothers and calves.

bear.description: Bears are large mammals that can be dangerous if surprised or provoked.
bear.safety_tips: Store food away from campsites, carry bear spray, and avoid direct encounters.

wolf.description: Wolves are social carnivores, usually found in packs.
wolf.safety_tips: Do not feed or approach wolves. Keep pets on a leash and avoid dens.

crocodile.description: Crocodiles are large aquatic reptiles found in rivers and lakes.
crocodile.safety_tips: Stay away from water edges. Avoid swimming in areas known for crocodiles.

snake.description: Snakes are legless reptiles; some are venomous.
snake.safety_tips: Watch where you step, do not touch unknown snakes, and wear boots when hiking.

hippopotamus.description: Hippos are large, aggressive herbivores found in African rivers and lakes.
hippopotamus.safety_tips: Keep boats at a safe distance and never stand between a hippo and water.

kangaroo.description: Kangaroos are large marsupials from Australia known for hopping and strong legs.
kangaroo.safety_tips: Do not approach or feed wild kangaroos. Be cautious when driving in rural areas.

giraffe.description: Giraffes are tall herbivores with long necks, native to Africa.
giraffe.safety_tips: Observe from a distance and avoid standing near them as they can kick if threatened.

zebra.description: Zebras are African equids known for their black-and-white stripes.
zebra.safety_tips: Keep distance in the wild. Do not attempt to feed or chase them.

cheetah.description: Cheetahs are fast African predators with slender bodies and spotted coats.
cheetah.safety_tips: Observe from a safe distance; never attempt to approach a cheetah.

leopard.description: Leopards are agile cats with distinctive rosette-patterned coats.
leopard.safety_tips: Avoid areas where leopards are active. Do not leave pets outside unattended.

hyena.description: Hyenas are social carnivores known for scavenging and powerful jaws.
hyena.safety_tips: Do not leave food unsecured. Keep a safe distance from hyena packs.

monkey.description: Monkeys are primates that can be found in forests and urban areas.
monkey.safety_tips: Do not feed or tease monkeys. Secure belongings as they may snatch items.

gorilla.description: Gorillas are large primates living in African forests with strong social groups.
gorilla.safety_tips: Observe from a distance. Avoid direct eye contact or loud noises.

chimpanzee.description: Chimpanzees are intelligent primates found in African forests.
chimpanzee.safety_tips: Do not approach or feed chimps. Maintain safe viewing distance.

rhino.description: Rhinoceroses are large herbivores with thick skin and one or two horns.
rhino.safety_tips: Keep a safe distance and do not block their path in the wild.

buffalo.description: Buffalo are large herbivores found in Africa and Asia.
buffalo.safety_tips: Do not get too close; they can charge if threatened.

deer.description: Deer are herbivores found worldwide in forests and grasslands.
deer.safety_tips: Observe from a distance. Do not try to feed wild deer.

moose.description: Moose are large deer species found in northern forests.
moose.safety_tips: Keep distance, especially from males in rutting season, as they can be aggressive.

fox.description: Foxes are small to medium carnivores known for their cunning and adaptability.
fox.safety_tips: Avoid feeding. Keep pets safe and secure trash bins.

raccoon.description: Raccoons are nocturnal mammals known for dexterous paws.
raccoon.safety_tips: Do not feed raccoons. Secure food and garbage to avoid encounters.

skunk.description: Skunks are small mammals capable of spraying a strong-smelling liquid.
skunk.safety_tips: Keep distance. Do not attempt to touch or corner a skunk.

otter.description: Otters are playful aquatic mammals found in rivers and coastal areas.
otter.safety_tips: Observe from a distance. Do not disturb their habitat.

beaver.description: Beavers are semi-aquatic rodents known for building dams.
beaver.safety_tips: Avoid disturbing dams. Keep pets away from their territory.

eagle.description: Eagles are large birds of prey with excellent vision.
eagle.safety_tips: Observe from a distance; do not approach nests.

hawk.description: Hawks are birds of prey known for sharp talons and hunting skills.
hawk.safety_tips: Do not approach nests or attempt to feed wild hawks.

owl.description: Owls are nocturnal birds with exceptional vision and silent flight.
owl.safety_tips: Observe quietly from a distance; avoid disturbing roosts.

falcon.description: Falcons are fast birds of prey known for their hunting dives.
falcon.safety_tips: Do not approach nesting areas. Keep distance from wild falcons.

parrot.description: Parrots are colorful, intelligent birds often found in tropical forests.
parrot.safety_tips: Observe from a distance; do not attempt to capture wild parrots.

peacock.description: Peacocks are large, colorful birds known for their iridescent tail feathers.
peacock.safety_tips: Keep distance; avoid loud noises near wild peacocks.

pigeon.description: Pigeons are urban-dwelling birds found worldwide.
pigeon.safety_tips: Avoid feeding large groups; maintain hygiene.

dove.description: Doves are gentle birds often symbolizing peace.
dove.safety_tips: Observe from a distance; do not disturb nests.

penguin.description: Penguins are flightless birds living mostly in the Southern Hemisphere.
penguin.safety_tips: Observe from a distance. Avoid disturbing colonies.

seal.description: Seals are marine mammals found on coasts and ice flows.
seal.safety_tips: Do not approach; maintain a safe distance from haul-outs.

sea_lion.description: Sea lions are marine mammals with external ears and strong flippers.
sea_lion.safety_tips: Observe from a distance; avoid sudden movements near them.

whale.description: Whales are large marine mammals known for their size and intelligence.
whale.safety_tips: Observe from boats at a safe distance; never attempt to touch or feed.

dolphin.description: Dolphins are intelligent marine mammals known for playful behavior.
dolphin.safety_tips: Observe from boats; do not chase or harass wild dolphins.

shark.description: Sharks are predatory fish found in oceans worldwide.
shark.safety_tips: Follow swimming safety guidelines. Avoid areas where sharks are known to feed.

octopus.description: Octopuses are intelligent cephalopods with eight arms and soft bodies.
octopus.safety_tips: Do not touch unknown species; observe safely in aquariums or reefs.

jellyfish.description: Jellyfish are marine invertebrates that can sting.
jellyfish.safety_tips: Avoid touching jellyfish; wear protective footwear in water if needed.

crab.description: Crabs are crustaceans found in oceans and coastal areas.
crab.safety_tips: Avoid handling unfamiliar crabs; watch for pinchers.

lobster.description: Lobsters are large marine crustaceans with strong claws.
lobster.safety_tips: Do not touch wild lobsters; use tools for handling in seafood markets.

frog.description: Frogs are amphibians that live in water and on land.
frog.safety_tips: Do not touch unknown frogs; some species are poisonous.

toad.description: Toads are amphibians with dry, bumpy skin.
toad.safety_tips: Avoid handling unknown species; wash hands if touched.

salamander.description: Salamanders are small amphibians with moist skin.
salamander.safety_tips: Do not touch wild salamanders; some secrete toxins.

newt.description: Newts are small amphibians related to salamanders.
newt.safety_tips: Observe from a distance; avoid touching wild specimens.

turtle.description: Turtles are reptiles with protective shells.
turtle.safety_tips: Do not disturb nests; handle carefully if necessary.

tortoise.description: Tortoises are land-dwelling reptiles with hard shells.
tortoise.safety_tips: Avoid handling; keep distance in the wild.
